member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment
member.summary: Rerpresents the environment of a program, which includes variable's and their values.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with no parent.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment.#ctor(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with a parent environment.
member.param: The parent of the current environment.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment.Get(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token)
member.summary: Searches current and parent environment for given token (variable) and returns it if found; otherwise, an exception is thrown.
member.returns: The value of the token stored in the environment.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment.GetAt(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a variable's value by stepping through a certain known number of scopes.
member.param: Number of steps between current environment and variable's environment.
Name of variable being searched for.
member.returns: Value of variable stored in the ancestors environment.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment.Define(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Defines a new variable with the givem name and value in the current environment.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment.Assign(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token,System.Object)
member.summary: Assigns a value to an existing variable. If the variable does not exist, an exception is thrown.
member.param: New value to be assigned to existing variable.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment.AssignAt(System.Int32,Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token,System.Object)
member.summary: Assigns a variable using its ancestor's environment.
member.param: Number of environments between current environment and ancestor environment.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Environment.Ancestor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Steps through a specified number of environments until an environment is located.
member.param: Number of environments between current environment and ancestor environment.
member.returns: Ancestor environment.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.ILoxCallable
member.summary: Represents the ability to call a Lox function.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.ILoxCallable.Arity
member.summary: Gets the arity of a function and returns it.
member.returns: The number of the function's paraneters/arguments.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.ILoxCallable.Call(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object})
member.summary: Declares the argument of the function in it's own environment and executes it's body.
member.param: Interpreter used to interpret and execute the body.
member.returns: A value if the "return" keyword is used, otherwise; returns .

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter
member.summary: Represents an interpreter that takes in a syntax tree and evaluates it.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.ClockFunction
member.summary: Represents the native Lox function "clock()", which returns the current time in seconds.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with a global and base environment and a native .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.Interpret(System.Collections.Generic.List{Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Stmt})
member.summary: Entry point to interpreter, catches and reports an runtime error if one is thrown.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.Resolve(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Expr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Stores resolution information in a side-table for when variables and assignments are executed.

Number of scopes between the current scope and the enclosing scope of the interpreter.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.Execute(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Stmt)
member.summary: Base call that executes a statement.

member.summary: Executes a block of statements with their own . After it is finished executing, it restores the base environment.
member.param: Environment for the scope of the block of statements.

member.summary: Evaluates an expression through the Visior paradigm.
member.returns: An object containing the result of the evaluation.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.CheckNumberOperand(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token,System.Object)
member.summary: Verifies that a singular operand is a number. An exception is thrown when the operand is not a number.

member.summary: Verifies that both the left and right operands are both numbers. Throws exception if either are not a number.

member.summary: Handles how boolean values are treated in Lox.
member.returns: if the input is True or is a non-null value; otherwise, if False or .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.IsEqual(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Handles what is treated as equal.
member.returns: if a and b are equivalent objects or if a and b are null, otherwise, .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.LookUpVariable(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token,Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Expr)
member.summary: Looks for a variable, first in the locals scope, then within the global scope.
member.param: Name of variable to be searched.
member.returns: The variable's value if found.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Interpreter.Stringify(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts an object to a string. All integers are treated as doubles in Lox, so the decimal is removed.
member.param: Object to be converted into a string.
member.returns: A string equivalent of the object.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox
member.summary: Represents the entry point to the Jlox interepreter. It is responsible for reading and running Lox files/lines of code and reporting errors.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox.Main(System.String[])
member.summary: Handles when and how to run jlox, either in line-by-line in the terminal or runnning a file specified by path.
member.param: The command line arguments on which to run jlox. Optional specification of file name or path is allowed.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox.RunFile(System.String)
member.summary: Takes a file name or path and executes the contents of that file. If an error occurs in running the code, the code will stop being executed.
member.param: File name or path of file that is being interpreted.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox.RunPrompt
member.summary: Allows the user to enter jlox code line by line in a terminal and have their code be executed line by line until EOF. To end a file, type CTRL+Z+ENTER.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox.Run(System.String)
member.summary: Runs the source code by using a scanner to scan in tokens and parsing the tokens into expressions.
member.param: The file contents or line of code to be executed.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox.Error(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Calls to report an error.
member.param: Line where the error was found.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox.Error(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token,System.String)
member.summary: Calls to report an error.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox.RuntimeError(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.RuntimeError)
member.summary: Reports a runtime error and indicates to the class that an error has occured.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Lox.Report(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Prints an error message to the terminal and changes the Lox class to be in an error state.
member.param: Line where the error was found.
Location in line where error occurs.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.ParseError
member.summary: Inherits from the class in order to throw and report errors.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a list of tokens.
member.param: List of tokents to populate class's token field

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Parse
member.summary: Serves as an entry point to parsing the Lox language into executable statement with recursive descent.
member.returns: A valid list of statements or expressions. This list may contain null values for errors.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Declaration
member.summary: Represents the rule for a declaration, which could be either an variable/function declaration or a statement. Catches a parsing error if one is thrown.
member.returns: A valid statement, variable declaration statement, or if an error is caught.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Function(System.String)
member.summary: Represents the syntax of a functino declaration (i.e. fun foo(x,y) { statements }).
member.param: Type of name expected, can be "function" or "method" for classes.
member.returns: A valid function statement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.VarDeclaration
member.summary: Represents the syntax of a variable declaration.
member.returns: A variable statement with its own name and value.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Statement
member.summary: Represents the statement rule, which could be a print, a block, an expression, a for, a while, an if, or a return statement.
member.returns: A valid print, block, expression, for, while, if, or return statement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.PrintStatement
member.summary: Represents the syntax of a print statement. Checks for a valid expression and a semicolon.
member.returns: A valid print statement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.ExpressionStatement
member.summary: Represents the syntax of a valid expression statement (one that requires a semicolon at the end).
member.returns: A valid expression statement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.IfStatement
member.summary: Rerpresents the syntax of a valid if statement, similar to the C language.
member.returns: A valid if statement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.WhileStatement
member.summary: Represents the sytanx of a valid while loop, similar to the C language.
member.returns: A valid while loop.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.ForStatement
member.summary: Reresents the syntax of a valid for loop, similar to the C language.
member.returns: A valid for loop.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.ReturnStatement
member.summary: Represents the syntax of a return statement.
member.returns: A valid return statement with the expression parsed if there is one.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Block
member.summary: Repreents the syntax of a block statement, which could be an empty block or a block of declarations enclosed by {}.
member.returns: A list of valid declaration statements.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Expression
member.summary: Represents the expression rule that consists of an assignment.
member.returns: A valid expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Assignment
member.summary: Represents the rule for assignment. Treats the left-hand side as its own expression.
member.returns: A valid expression or assignment expression if appropriate.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Or
member.summary: Reresents the syntax to an or opertor, which is similar to a binary operator with special condiitions.
member.returns: A valid or operator, or a valid and operator.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.And
member.summary: Represents the syntax to an and operator, which is similar to a binary operator with special conditions.
member.returns: A valid or operator, or an equality expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Equality
member.summary: Represents the equality rule and checks for the equality operators within an expression.
member.returns: A valid equality expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Comparison
member.summary: Represents the comparison rule and checks for comparison operators within an expression.
member.returns: A valid comparison expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Term
member.summary: Represents the term rule, which checks for adding/subtracting.
member.returns: A valid term expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Factor
member.summary: Represents the factor rule, which checks for multiplication/division
member.returns: A valid factor expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Unary
member.summary: Represents the unary rule, which checks for the operators ! and negation.
member.returns: A valid unary expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Call
member.summary: Represents the syntax of a function call.
member.returns: A valid function call expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.FinishCall(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Expr)
member.summary: Helper function to , parses up to 255 arguments of a function call.
member.param: Function whose arguments we are parsing.
member.returns: A valid function call expression with arguments.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Primary
member.summary: Represents the primary rule, which checks for literals and other terminals (such as nil). Will throw errors in cases of bad grouping use.
member.returns: A valid literal, or will throw an exception if problems in syntax are present.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Match(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.TokenType[])
member.summary: Checks if a number of types mach the current token.
member.returns: if the type(s) match the currents token's type and advances to the next token; otherwise; .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Consume(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.TokenType,System.String)
member.summary: Consumes tokens until the type matching the input type is found. Throws an exception if the input type is not found.
member.param: Error message to print in case the input type is not found.
member.returns: The token matching the input's type if an exception is not thrown.'

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Check(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.TokenType)
member.summary: Checks if the input's type is the same as the current token's type.
member.returns: if the input's type matches the current token's type; if at the end of the token list or the types do not match.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Advance
member.summary: Advances to the next token if not at the end of the token list.
member.returns: The original token before advancement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.IsAtEnd
member.summary: Checks current position in token list.
member.returns: if at the end of the list (indicated by EOF ); otherwise .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Peek
member.summary: Returns the current token without advancing to the next token.
member.returns: The current token.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Previous
member.summary: Returns the previous token without advancing to the next toke.
member.returns: The previous token.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Error(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token,System.String)
member.summary: Reports to the class that an error has occured.
member.returns: A exception.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Parser.Synchronize
member.summary: Continues advancing until the start of the next statement in order to restore a parser's state.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver
member.summary: Represents a resolver that figures out which variables refer to what before interpreting. Ensures that the closure mechanism works properly.

member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with the specified interpreter.
member.param: The interpreter to be used after the resolver.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.VisitBlockStmt(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Stmt.Block)
member.summary: Resolves the variables for variable/assignment expressions within a block statement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.VisitFunctionStmt(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Stmt.Function)
member.summary: Resolves a function declaration statement.
member.param: Function declaration statement to be resolved.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.VisitVarStmt(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Stmt.Var)
member.summary: Adds an entry to the current innermost scope's dictionary.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.VisitVariableExpr(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Expr.Variable)
member.summary: Checks if a variable is present in its initializer before resolving it.

member.summary: Resolves an assignment expression.

member.summary: Resolves the variables for variable/assignment expressions within a block statement.

member.summary: Helper function that resolves a statement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.Resolve(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Expr)
member.summary: Helper function that resolves an expression.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.ResolveLocal(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Expr,Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token)
member.summary: Walks through the scopes, innermost to outermost, looking the the specified name and expresion and resolves it if found.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.ResolveFunction(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Stmt.Function,Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.FunctionType)
member.summary: Resolves a function's body and it's parameters within the functions scope. Also updates what the enclosing function is so we know if we are inside a function or not.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.BeginScope
member.summary: Starts a new scope as the innermost scope.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.EndScope
member.summary: Ends the innermost scope.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.Declare(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token)
member.summary: Declares a variable in the current innermost scope, but does not resolve it.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Resolver.Define(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token)
member.summary: Defines a variable as useable after the initializer has been resolved, resolves the variable as well.
member.param: Variable to be defined and resolved.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Return
member.summary: Represents the return exception, which is invoked in order to return from a function call.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Return.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with the specified value.
member.param: Value to be returned, can be .

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.RuntimeError
member.summary: Represents a runtime error within the Lox Interpreter, inherits from the class.

member.summary: Constructor, calls as well to initiate error message.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner
member.summary: Represents the scanning of source code into tokens.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.#cctor
member.summary: Generates a dictionary of reserved words for the Lox language.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with the specified source.
member.param: Source code to scan tokens from.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.ScanTokens
member.summary: Calls while not at the end of the file in order to handle scnaning. Adds an EOF token at the end of the token list.
member.returns: A list of s with an EOF token at the end of the list.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.ScanToken
member.summary: Iterates through each character to determine the lexemes and tokens of the source code. Reports an error when an unrecognize character is read.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.MultiLineComment
member.summary: Identifies the end of a multi-line comment and reports an error if the end is never reached.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.Identifier
member.summary: Determines if a lexeme is an identifier or a reserved word of the language. Once identified, it calls to add the lexeme to the token list.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.Number
member.summary: Identifies a lexeme as a number and adds it as a token. All numbers are handled as floating-point decimals.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.StringMethod
member.summary: Identifies a lexeme as a string and adds it as a token. Reports an error if the string is unterminated.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.Match(System.Char)
member.summary: Takes a character and compares it to the source at the current character. Iterates current if the character matches
member.returns: if the characters match; otherwise, if at the end of the source or if the characters do not match.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.Peek
member.summary: Takes a peek at the current character and returns it.
member.returns: The null terminator if at the end of the list; otherwise, returns the current character in source.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.PeekNext
member.summary: Takes a peek at the next character and returns it.
member.returns: The null terminator if at the end of the list; otherwise, returns the next character in source.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.IsDigit(System.Char)
member.summary: Checks if a character is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive.
member.returns: if the character is a digit between 0 and 9; otherwise, .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.IsAlpha(System.Char)
member.summary: Checks if a character is a letter (A-Z or a-z) or underscore.
member.returns: if the character is a letter or underscore; otherwise .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.IsAlphaNumeric(System.Char)
member.summary: Checks if a character is an alphanumeric character or an underscore.
member.returns: if the character is an alphanumeric charcter or an underscore; otherwise .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.IsAtEnd
member.summary: Checks if the position is at the end of source.
member.returns: if position is at the end of the source; otherwise .

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.Advance
member.summary: Advances the index pointer to the next index of the .
member.returns: Original character that pointed to before advancement.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.AddToken(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.TokenType)
member.summary: Calls with null as the second argument to add a token to the list.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Scanner.AddToken(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.TokenType,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a token to the list with a type, the lexeme itself, literal, and line number.
member.param: Actual value of lexeme if applicable.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token
member.summary: Represents a token that has a type, lexeme, a literal, and the line it is on.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token.#ctor(Lox_Interpreter.Lox.TokenType,System.String,System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes an instace of the class.
member.param: The raw representation of the code from the source.
Literal value of the token if it is a string or a number.
Line number the token is present on.

member.name: M:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.Token.ToString
member.summary: Generates a string representation of a token.
member.returns: A string with a token's type, lexeme, and literal value if applicable.

member.name: T:Lox_Interpreter.Lox.TokenType
member.summary: Represents all the possible types of tokens there can be in Lox.
